Incident.Summary: FUGITIVE WARRANT SERVICE. SUBJECT ENCOUNTERED AT AN EXXON GAS STATION IN ELKTON, MD.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
SCENE PROCESSING:

    A copy of the FOA/Warrant packet can be found in "Attachments."

    I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, am equipped with a body-worn camera. My body-worn camera was used to record this incident. 

NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK:

    A neighborhood check was not conducted. 

WANTED SUBJECT:

    NAME: JOHN PAUL ANDERSON (W/M)
    DATE OF BIRTH: NOVEMBER 15, 1972
    ADDRESS: 87 CHERRY HILL ROAD, ELKTON, MD 21921
    DATE OF ARREST: APRIL 26, 2023
    TIME OF ARREST: 1921 HOURS
    WARRANT: CHESTER COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA; BENCH WARRANT: PROBATION VIOLATION
    WARRANT CONTROL NO.: 15-BV-0000333-2021

NARRATIVE:

    On April 26, 2023, at approximately 1903 hours, I, Trooper First Class Scott (#7217) of the Maryland State Police, was dispatched to the Exxon gas station located at 4428 Telegraph Road, Elkton, Maryland 21921 in response to what would become a warrant service. I arrived on scene at approximately 1913 hours. 

    Upon arrival, I observed a blue Ford F-150 bearing Maryland registration 7ET1691 parked to the side of the Exxon convenience store. An employee in the store told me the occupant of the Ford F-150 came in to make a purchase hours ago before going back out to the vehicle and falling asleep. The occupant of the vehicle remained asleep for a few hours, causing the employee to become concerned. 

    When I approached the vehicle, I observed the engine was off and the hood of the vehicle felt cool to the touch. I observed a white male slumped forward in the driver's seat, with the ignition keys in his lap. The male awoke to me knocking on the window. 

    When the male opened the door, he identified himself as John Paul Anderson (see "Wanted Subject"). I would also later view John's Maryland identification card, verifying his identity.

    I observed John's speech appeared to be slurred, and his eyes were bloodshot. As a result of this, coupled with his position in the driver's seat, with the keys, and his slumped/sleeping status, I asked John to participate in Standardized Field Sobriety Testing. John was somewhat hesitant, citing concerns he had just woken up, but ultimately he consented to Standardized Field Sobriety Testing. I also observed he appeared to have some gauze in his mouth, and I learned over the course of our interactions in this incident that John had at least one tooth removed (the gauze and his claim of a missing tooth would explain his slurred speech). 

    During the course of my interaction with John, I was advised that John had a potential extraditable warrant through Pennsylvania. The bench warrant for John (see "Wanted Subject") was confirmed to be active and extraditable while I administered Standardized Field Sobriety Testing. After Standardized Field Sobriety Testing, I did not believe John was actually impaired. John was subsequently arrested on the extraditable warrant (PA) at approximately 1921 hours. 

    I transported John to the Cecil County Commissioner's Office for his initial appearance. We arrived at the Commissioner's Office at approximately 2007 hours. After his initial appearance, John was held without bond on the Pennsylvania bench warrant. I transported John to the Cecil County Detention Center, arriving with him in custody at approximately 2132 hours. Custody of John was subsequently transferred to the Cecil County Detention Center. I cleared from the detention center at approximately 2156 hours. 

    A set of keys for John's vehicle, his wallet, and cellular phone were left in the care of Trooper First Class Steinmetz (#7290) while I transported John to the Commissioner's Office. Trooper First Class Steinmetz stood by with John's vehicle until John's father retrieved it from the Exxon gas station. John's father retrieved the F-150 and the set of keys, John's cellular phone, and John's wallet at approximately 2008 hours. Any remaining items John had on him were transported with John to the Cecil County Detention Center. 

    Case cleared by arrest. 

    All events occurred in Cecil County, Maryland.
